title: Can the timesteps T in deep reinforcement learning be trained?
body_html: Recently I'm trying to implement a deep reinforcement learning project which require a variable timesteps.I want to train a network to output a parameter T,and use T as the length or timesteps of policy gradient method or DQN method,I wonder if that's implementable? I mean when we do back-propogate, can me back-propogate through timesteps T？

I mean when we do back-propogate, can me back-propogate through timesteps T？
